metadata.title: CVE-2018-8780 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
In Ruby before 2.2.10, 2.3.x before 2.3.7, 2.4.x before 2.4.4, 2.5.x before2.5.1, and 2.6.0-preview1, the Dir.open, Dir.new, Dir.entries andDir.empty? methods do not check NULL characters. When using thecorresponding method, unintentional directory traversal may be performed.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-8780` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libruby1.9.1 - 1.9.3.484-2ubuntu1.11
libtcltk-ruby1.9.1 - 1.9.3.484-2ubuntu1.11
ri1.9.1 - 1.9.3.484-2ubuntu1.11
ruby1.9.1 - 1.9.3.484-2ubuntu1.11
ruby1.9.1-examples - 1.9.3.484-2ubuntu1.11
ruby1.9.1-full - 1.9.3.484-2ubuntu1.11
ruby1.9.3 - 1.9.3.484-2ubuntu1.11
No subscription required

libruby2.0 - 2.0.0.484-1ubuntu2.9
ruby2.0 - 2.0.0.484-1ubuntu2.9
ruby2.0-tcltk - 2.0.0.484-1ubuntu2.9
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ruby1.9.1 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.9.3.484-2ubuntu1.11').
ruby2.0 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.0.0.484-1ubuntu2.9').
